sure... ok first you need to know what device the NTFS drive is on. If it was the primary slave drive, 2nd partition, on and IDE/ATA type drive, it would be /dev/hdb2, pri master, 1st part, /dev/hda1 , and so on.. you also need a mount point which is just an empty directory.. lets say /mnt/D is that point.. then you would simply issue the command:   sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/hdb2 /mnt/D
which would make /mnt/D have all the stuff that ntfs drive does... cp is the linux command for 'copy' , so cp /mnt/D/somefile.zip /home/grodius/whateverdir/ would copy a file...
man cp  and  man mount  for more info..
